actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, Treasury Department, Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to remove the restriction that only earnings before the year of attainment of age 62 may be used in the transitional provision (commonly referred to as the "notch" provision) relating to individuals born between 1917 and 1921.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to permit the earnings of an individual over age 62 to be used in the benefit computation provision used for individuals born between 1917 and 1922.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to remove the restriction that only earnings before the year of attainment of age 62 may be used in the transitional provision (commonly referred to as the "notch" provision) relating to individuals born between 1917 and 1921.
